summary: Freya\'s Raiment, a gift from the Norse goddess of beauty, war and death. This mod adds a new, standalone armored battle dress to meet the needs of discerning female characters.
descriptionHtml:
[img]http://img849.imageshack.us/img849/4135/freyatitleb.png[/img]

  Since I started playing Skyrim, I\'ve been searching for armor for a female character that made sense, defensively and structurally, looked decent, and actually looked kind of feminine. I\'m too tired of all the skimpy armor, battle bikinis (or even less!) that you\'d freeze to death in, if you weren\'t stabbed in one of your many unprotected vital areas first. Hopefully, with this mod I have achieved that.

If you use and enjoy the armor, or want to see more, please comment or endorse! I love hearing feedback on what you like or what I can improve.

----------------------------------------------------o-0-O-0-o----------------------------------------------------


  Introducing Freya\'s Raiment, a new armored battle dress to meet the needs of discerning female characters. 
Freya is the Norse goddess of beauty, war and death, so I found it only fitting to name the armor after her. 

This mod adds a new, standalone armor to the game. 
It\'s a set of female light armor, Which can be crafted at any forge. (Ebony perk required.)
Fully upgradable and enchantable, it requires ebony and silver ingots to create.
Currently there is only the body armor, gauntlets and boots. No helmet.

You can also find it using the console commands for \"Freya\"
Stat-wise, the set is fairly close to the Dragon sets. 



If you prefer, you can find and download this from the Steam Workshop, here:

[url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=138394532]Freya\'s Raiment on the Skyrim Steam Workshop[/url]



----------------------------------------------------o-0-O-0-o----------------------------------------------------



This armor is currently a work in progress, and I will be updating it when I find the time to make improvements. 
Steam Workshop files will most likely be updated with improved versions, but expect to find all updates and alternate versions on the Nexus.

Planned updates:
 -Improved and higher resolution textures
 -Make adjustments to normal and specular maps.
 -Add a heavy armor version
 -Create color variants
 -Design a helm/circlet?





Original credit to A TYPE2, for his Oblivion mod mesh which I\'ve altered and fixed.
Thank you!
author: MsMatching
